intro: Saccoloma moluccanum, commonly known as the Moluccan saccoloma, is a member of the family Polypodiaceae. It is a small, terrestrial fern that typically grows in shaded, moist environments. The plant has a short, creeping rhizome with numerous slender, dichotomously branched fronds. Its leaves are usually pinnately divided and have a delicate, feathery appearance. Saccoloma moluccanum is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and is often found in forest undergrowth.
